age_under_20_count_parcels.long_description: The population estimates under age 20. 5-year ACS estimates in provided census geolevels. For non-census geolevels (such as zip codes), spatial overlaps are calculated between census block groups and parcels, then the value of each block group is divided across all living units within each intersecting parcel. Once parcel-level values are assigned, spatial overlaps are calculated between parcels and target regions such that parcel values can be aggregated to each intersecting target region based on proportion of overlap. Redistribution to non-census geolevels was performed using the redistribute R package.
age_under_20_count_parcels.statement: The population under age 20 is {value} in {region_name}.

population_parcels.long_name: Population: Total Number of People (parcels method)
population_parcels.long_description: Total number of people, as reported in census ACS population data. For non-census geographies, values are redistributed from census block groups to parcels, based on proportional geometric overlap and weighted by number of living units per parcel, then from parcels to the local regions based on proportional geometric overlap, using the redistribute R package.

population_density_direct.long_name: Population Density: People Per Square Mile (direct method)
population_density_direct.long_description: Population density, or number of people per square mile, as calculated from census ACS population data and shapefile areas: \[\frac{population_{r}}{meters^{2}_{r}}1609.344^{2}\] Where r is each region (e.g., census tract or county). For non-census geographies, values are redistributed based on proportional overlap between census block groups and the local regions, using the redistribute R package.
population_density_direct.statement: There are {value} people per square mile in {region_name}.

sources.name: American Community Survey
sources.location: 5-Year estimates, table B01003, via the API

sources.name: Fairfax County Geospatial Data
sources.location: Health & Human Service > Human Services Regions

population_density_parcels.long_name: Population Density: People Per Square Mile (parcels method)
population_density_parcels.long_description: Population density, or number of people per square mile, as calculated from census ACS population data and shapefile areas: \[\frac{population_{r}}{meters^{2}_{r}}1609.344^{2}\] Where r is each region (e.g., census tract or county). For non-census geographies, values are redistributed from census block groups to parcels, based on proportional geometric overlap and weighted by number of living units per parcel, then from parcels to the local regions based on proportional geometric overlap, using the redistribute R package.
population_density_parcels.statement: There are {value} people per square mile in {region_name}.

race_afr_amer_alone_count_parcels.long_description: The Black population. 5-year ACS estimates in provided census geolevels. For non-census geolevels (such as zip codes), spatial overlaps are calculated between census block groups and parcels, then the value of each block group is divided across all living units within each intersecting parcel. Once parcel-level values are assigned, spatial overlaps are calculated between parcels and target regions such that parcel values can be aggregated to each intersecting target region based on proportion of overlap. Redistribution to non-census geolevels was performed using the redistribute R package.

race_two_or_more_count_parcels.short_name: The two or more races population parcels
race_two_or_more_count_parcels.long_name: The two or more races population.
race_two_or_more_count_parcels.short_description: The two or more races population.
race_two_or_more_count_parcels.long_description: The two or more races population. 5-year ACS estimates in provided census geolevels. For non-census geolevels (such as zip codes), spatial overlaps are calculated between census block groups and parcels, then the value of each block group is divided across all living units within each intersecting parcel. Once parcel-level values are assigned, spatial overlaps are calculated between parcels and target regions such that parcel values can be aggregated to each intersecting target region based on proportion of overlap. Redistribution to non-census geolevels was performed using the redistribute R package.
race_two_or_more_count_parcels.statement: The two or more races population is {value} in {region_name}.
